content: i got home from a particularly stressful day at work today and just
had to make something then i looked down at my mouse pad and realized you know
what i don't have a dice tray so let's do that everyone else seems to
have one why don't i i simply measured the size of the mouse
pad and cut a nice foundation of double corrugated cardboard from my good stock
this is from a tv that i bought and then just blacked out the edges in
my garage i had this spare slab of craft balls so that i was going to use to
teach my six-year-old how to use a table saw
but its time has come so using this little proxen
craft grade table saw i cut some one and three-quarter inch strips
and then chop those to the right length to fit around my foundation
tried a few colors of acrylic brown paint found the tone that i liked
and then applied it just painted it on there pretty watered down and then
wiping the excess off quickly just like you would with real wood stain
then i hot glued these pieces onto the foundation in goes the mouse pad and
wham 10 minute dice tray and here it is with
those oh so beautiful ylox armory dice yes and it's modular i could remove that
mouse pad if i want put in different designs in the future
of course now i have no mouse pad so i did have to go on amazon and re-buy this
one but that's okay thus endeth my journal
entry thanks for joining me make things and play games
you
